conversation.thought:
My goal is to maximize my rank. My top choice is School_D, but I am the lowest priority (5th) on School_D's list. Given that School_D is the #1 choice for Students C, D, and E as well, and Students C, D, E all rank higher than me on School_D's list (D is #2, E is #3, C is #4), applying to School_D guarantees immediate rejection, as Student_D will likely be accepted by School_D in Round 1.

My second choice is School_A. I am the 4th priority on School_A's list. The students ranked higher than me (E, C, D) all prefer School_D (#1 preference) strongly. Assuming they apply to School_D in Round 1, School_A will likely receive few applications, perhaps only mine, in this round.

If I apply to School_A now, I secure my #2 choice. If I wait and apply to D first, I will be rejected, and in the next round, S_E and S_C (who rank higher than me at A) will also be rejected by D and will apply to A, leading to my rejection from A as well. Therefore, applying immediately to School_A is the optimal strategy to maximize my outcome.
